FlowGraph

Class InputCoordinatesAdapter

Namespace
FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input
Assembly
FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll

Implementation of IInputCoordinates that abstracts away rendering mode differences for coordinate handling.

This adapter automatically detects the current rendering mode and uses the appropriate coordinate conversion strategy:

  • Visual Tree mode: GetPosition(MainCanvas) already returns canvas coordinates
  • Direct Rendering mode: GetPosition(RootPanel) returns viewport coordinates, requires transform
public sealed class InputCoordinatesAdapter : IInputCoordinates

Methods

GetPointerCanvasPosition(PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position in canvas coordinates.

This is the primary method for getting pointer position during interactions. Use for hit testing, node positioning, edge endpoints, selection bounds, etc.

Works correctly regardless of rendering mode:

  • Visual Tree mode: Uses GetPosition(MainCanvas) which applies inverse transform
  • Direct Rendering mode: Uses GetPosition(RootPanel) + manual inverse transform
public CanvasPoint GetPointerCanvasPosition(PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

e PointerEventArgs

The pointer event.

Returns

CanvasPoint

Pointer position in canvas coordinates.

GetPointerViewportPosition(PointerEventArgs)

Gets the current pointer position in viewport coordinates.

Use for operations that work in screen space:

  • Auto-pan edge detection
  • Fixed overlay positioning
  • Tooltip placement
public ViewportPoint GetPointerViewportPosition(PointerEventArgs e)

Parameters

e PointerEventArgs

The pointer event.

Returns

ViewportPoint

Pointer position in viewport coordinates.

GetViewportBounds()

Gets the viewport bounds (size of the visible area).

Returns a rect at (0,0) with the viewport's width and height. Use for auto-pan edge detection. 

public ViewportRect GetViewportBounds()

Returns

ViewportRect

GetVisibleCanvasRect()

Gets the visible area in canvas coordinates.

This represents the portion of the canvas that is currently visible in the viewport. Useful for:

  • Viewport culling during rendering
  • Determining if a node is visible
  • Calculating visible bounds for layout operations
public CanvasRect GetVisibleCanvasRect()

Returns

CanvasRect
